customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this product as Seagate does not honor the warranty. Product bought on 3/25/18, went to register it and it says it is out of warranty even though the box claims a two year warranty. Contacted Seagate and provided documentation of the purchase and they updated the warranty to be valid though 3/26/18. A 1 day warranty is what they gave me. Stay away or be disappointed.

customer_reviews.title: Don't throw away your original packaging
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for about a month, at which point it began to corrupt the files of every game installed on it. The games would start up, freeze, then when I exited out and restarted they would hang at the title screen and I would get an error for corrupted game data. Reformatting the drive did not work. Installing the games directly onto the Xbox hard drive afterwards worked perfectly, so it is not a problem with the Xbox. The original packaging is required (serial numbers, etc.) for warranty returns, so unfortunately I've thrown $90 down the drain.

But if you're a hardcore Xbox/gamer and want that little extra decrease and load time go for it

It works as it should, it's simple to use, just "plug and play". After plugging it in, it did it's formatting and was ready for use! What I like most about this is that there are no additional power cables, just the USB cable that connects to the console. Pros- Easy to use Maintenance Free Plug & Play Cons- None

The games have a little faster load times on this HDD than if the games were installed on the internal. Xbox One games are freaking HUGE in comparison to 360 games so if you're buying someone an Xbox One who prefers to keep their game collection through digital download instead of having a bunch of plastic cases sitting around, then grab this HDD. It's inexpensive, fast and well worth the money.

customer_reviews.title: Typical Seagate quality, unfortunately.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in Mid-September 2018 and here it is exactly 2 years and 1 month later, and the drive is dead with the click of death. Seagate quality has always let me down. Of the 7 seagate drives I've ever owned, this makes the 7th one to die a horrible death in under 3 years, taking my data (and in this case game data) with them. Not sure why I thought it would be different this time. Maybe it was the fancy green cover? Maybe it was the nice Xbox logo thinking Microsoft actually vetted the hardware to be better performing? Nope..... same Seagate garbage... new shiny green packaging. If you care about your data... avoid anything Seagate.

I use it for storage and to swap games between my 2 consoles! I don't keep it plugged in 24/7 to eliminate wear and tear, so I only actually plug it in when I'm gonna back something up or transfer out to internal storage! I highly recommend this drive for anyone that has to delete a game every time you want to download a new one cause you are scrambling for HD space!

Previously my sons used HGST Touro S 1TB drives which have 7200 rpm spinning drives and apparently the Seagates only use 5400 rpm drives. An external SSD would be faster but at 4TB the price would be $$$$. If you're using an original One or an S this external will still be faster than the internal drive.

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 2 years.
customer_reviews.text: Storage capacity is fair enough, but what you think is a long-term investment, ends up being a waste of money. After a little over two years this Seagate Hard Drive randomly stopped working and my Xbox will intermittently detect it. Obviously, I can't download or install games to it. I've tried all the suggested Microsoft and Seagate troubleshooting steps such as power cycling and connecting the drive to a Windows 10 PC, to run Seagate Tools, but even after formatting the drive, the problems still persist. My advice, get a different brand. The package on this drive is pretty and all, but seems that manufacturing quality is bad overall.
customer_reviews.author: Cone

customer_reviews.title: This is the drive to get!
customer_reviews.text: With this drive games load at least 25-30% faster. If this doesn't sound like much consider the XBONE load times on a lot of games are two to three minutes, This drive alone can shave an entire minute off load times! The only downside is it's only 1TB but this is pretty typical for SSD drives. The only reason you shouldn't get this drive is if you're only concerned about space and have hundreds of games and want a lot of them always installed. This shouldn't matter because you can always reinstall games that you remove. Bottom line if you have an Xbox One (Original, S, or X) this drive will improve your actual gaming experience.

Anyway, data is transferring right now and then I will have to transfer the rest from the old storage to the internal storage and then to the new storage. I don't think at 62 most grandmas do this kind of stuff. But, I like to keep the gaming system up to date and full of game for when the grandkids are around. I also like to play the games.

customer_reviews.text: No problems here, just plug it in and Xbox does the rest. Anyways I've downloaded a couple games and they work just fine. Some advice; get yourself an ethernet cable, because wifi will take you ALLLL DAAAYYY to download a game. I used a Cat 5 cable with max 100Mbps and it worked at full capacity, but I'd recommend a Cat 6 cable for even faster downloads (max 10Gbps). Bigger games can take an hour or so with the 5.

Very easy to use and you'll have to worry much less about having the correct games installed so that you can play with your friends.

First have the media file app downloaded on Xbox so it can detect this device. Then Just plug the cord into the game drive box first then plug it into the back or side (back recommended) of your Xbox One. If nothing shows, go in the media app and search &I open this device up.
customer_reviews.author: Long Y.

customer_reviews.title: Destiny 2 Loads Way Faster
customer_reviews.text: I bought this external drive to play destiny 2 on my old launch day Xbox one. It makes a world of difference. I can now open the character and quest menus in a second. Even in the middle of a firefight, the menus load lightning fast. Traveling to planets also takes around 20 seconds now. I was disappointed at first after I transferred destiny to the drive and played it. The load times were still the same. But I restarted my Xbox and the drive now works as expected. Super fast, and I hope it lasts a long time. It’s also very small which is a plus. It’s on top of my Xbox in the picture.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: Pros and cons of 8 terabyte hub
customer_reviews.text: Pros: 1. 7.1 terabytes after downloading 11 games. 2. Extremely easy to set up. 3. Excellent warrenty 4. Barely any noise. Just a barely audible hum. 5. Even though it looks huge it's rather small. Takes up the area on top of the xbox next to the cooling vent. 6. Comes with the required wires and multiple outlet adapters. 7. Simple and amazing design 8. 8 terabytes of gaming storage Cons: 1. Price 2. Really bulky and large wall outlet plug. Takes up 3 slots on the surge protector.

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for 11 months, then broke for good
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for using with an XBox One. Worked great. Then, one day eleven months later, it stopped working. I tried troubleshooting it, and I got it to work again for about an hour. Then it quit for good. It didn't get dropped or knocked around, was just sitting in an entertainment center the entire 11 months. Xbox wouldn't recognize the drive, PC wouldn't recognize it to recover the data or use repair tools. Checked the serial via the manufacturer's website, and it was out of warranty. $111 for 11 months isn't worth it, I won't be buying a replacement from Seagate.

customer_reviews.title: Does not work after 1 day

As soon as I turned my Xbox off, or unplugged the hard drive, it would stop working. The light on the hard drive would not come back on, and the Xbox would not even recognize the device. The unit felt like it was definitely running, but nothing showed up on the screen. For 80 bucks, you should be getting a great product, and that's why I tried again on this one, when the replacement performed the exact same as the first. DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.author: Clayton Bliss

customer_reviews.title: Not Good
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for Christmas for my son. Less than 30 days and it already quit working. Amazon is replacing it however, I am worried it's not a one time issue. For the price, this product should not have any issues. He has a different brand that has lasted a couple of years now, just not large enough for everything. Fingers crossed the replacement lasts.

customer_reviews.title: Super Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: These things are awesome! They give you so much space that you won't know what to do with it all. You could literally be and XBOX live member from now until the day you die and never fill this thing up even if you downloaded every months free games. Heh, Me I bought 2 for external storage. I have like 16G of space, INSANITY! the only suggestion I would give would be to add better instructions on how to install it. It didn't come with any and I hade to YouTube it.
customer_reviews.author: Steve  Fleck

customer_reviews.title: Destiny 2 Load Times
customer_reviews.text: I bought this specifically for Destiny 2. I was sick of waiting 20+ seconds for the inventory screen to load tiny thumbnails. With the game transferred to the SSD the inventory screen takes a second or two to load. Same with the quests tab. The initial loading time is halved and loading into planets takes about 20 seconds. Just make sure the usb cable is firmly seated flush on the SSD. the indicator light will still light up but the xbox will not see it if the plug is not ALL the way in. otherwise, most games load up a minute or so faster, some no appreciable difference, depends on how disk intensive they are.
customer_reviews.author: Luke Maidhoff

customer_reviews.title: May 2019: Awesome, but doesn't work for PS4, ignore some of the Q&A entries that say it does.
customer_reviews.text: After reading mixed responses I ordered this and tried to use it for PS4 extended storage but it was incompatible. It will work as a backup storage device but you can't store actual PS4 games on it like I needed so I swapped it for the plain black version of this 8 TB drive without the usb hubs which works fine. They had the same capacity before formatting, 8.01 TB but I guess the extra hubs made this one incompatible. It's a shame because this one looked sick standing next to my glacier white PS4 on its black cooling fan stand. Now I just have a shiny black box lying flat next to it, but what can you do?
customer_reviews.author: TheBusiness27

customer_reviews.title: Need More Xbox Space?
customer_reviews.text: I guess I was clueless when I thought that my family would keep using the disc version of Xbox games. Little did I know that there was something called "game sharing." Needless to say, we quickly ran out of space on our Xbox. So, I had to go the 4 terabyte way and get my college student son an external hard drive. Worked great. So great that I had to get one for his younger brother and then eventually his father. I think I have ordered this same one three times -- maybe not though because at least one was green and one was branded Xbox. All Seagate though. No complaints and game sharing has resumed!

customer_reviews.title: Excellent performance with set it and forget it installation
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical to the idea of running games off of an external, USB connected hard drive at first, but I have not noticed any issues with game loading time or boot up time from my year of using this product. Installation is a breeze and once it's connected I never have to think about it. This is a must-have if you subscribe to Xbox Game Pass. I download every game I'm even vaguely interested in and still have more than 1TB of space left.
customer_reviews.author: I Love Stuff

customer_reviews.title: Nice Drive for Backups, Great Value as well
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace several smaller drives, I have been using Seagate for years however the drives that failed this replaces were Seagate. I will be curious to see how well this works over time, but I was surprised how small it really is, unit is quiet, and pretty quick with USB 3. I am not sure I will use front USB ports but a nice to have, overall I am happy with the drive and for the price of 8GB you can’t beat it for backups.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and plentiful storage
customer_reviews.text: I have 30 or so new games on the storage device and I haven't scratched the surface in terms of diminishing it's storage capacity. You can also store songs on it and pair it with your media player. My only small complaint is that it does not shut down when my Xbox One X shuts down and will stay running and running. I don't understand this seeing that it is slaved to the Xbox One X. Otherwise, terrific product you can hold in one hand and carry to a friend's house to play your games there. Not loud with barely noticable operation and does not overheat.
customer_reviews.author: Zeb

customer_reviews.title: Excellent and simple to use external hard drive
customer_reviews.text: I love this simple plug and play HDD. Installation was a breeze. This was so easy to set up. All you have to do is plug it into a power source, plug it into one of the Xbox USB drives, and Xbox handles the rest when you power it on. Digital games take up so much room, I can’t live without an external hard drive anymore. Games load up just as quickly of the external hard drive as they do off of the Xbox’s internal hard drive This is worth every dollar!
customer_reviews.author: D. Schultz

I like that it has the neon green that says Xbox on it. The unit is very small and can just sit on the top of your Xbox, plugs into one of the USB ports on your actual Xbox. I highly recommend this product to increase your storage ability for gaming!

I ended up having him put the hard drive straight into my xbox instead of repairing it as an external hard drive. Point to be made is it's a great Hard Drive but it DOES NOT LAST!

customer_reviews.title: Plug and play ease for low-low memory Xbox One.

customer_reviews.title: Hard Drive Failure over time
customer_reviews.text: Seagate informed me that this drive should last several years. It's a perfect external drive companion for Xbox One. Ours died at 2 years. The Seagate MFG warranty is 1 year. I'm disappointed in the longevity because I have dozens of drives in different applications and I rarely have had a Seagate Drive ever fail. Some of mine have been spinning for more than a decade. So, to have this external drive die after 2yrs is disheartening and not what I am used to.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing and easy to set up

Plug it in to one of the USB ports on the back of the console. Turn your console on and it will recognize the device. You then want to click format for games and then you can start saving your games on it. I highly recomend it if you want extra storage.

customer_reviews.title: Speeds up game loads to near PC SSD times
customer_reviews.text: For years I’ve been ‘that guy’ that everyone had to wait for the game to load. No more, get one of these for your xbox one and you pop in the same time as the X owners. The drive installed easily, moving the games over to it after formatting was very easy. The difference is immediate, you won’t regret the purchase.

We considered ordering a regular stand-along hard drive, which would have been cheaper, but ordered this game drive specifically because we wanted it to integrate seamlessly. I will be purchasing another one of these hard drives to replace the one that stopped working.
